programme.title: 2025 Australian Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the year's first Grand Slam tournament; Jannik Sinner and Aryn Sabalenka are the defending champions.

programme.title: They Call It Late Night with Jason Kelce
programme.desc: Super Bowl champion Jason Kelce hosts his own late-night talk show with some help from his wife, Kylie, featuring his infectious brand of humor mixed in with interviews with celebrity guests across football, sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2025 Australian Open
programme.desc: Madison Keys appears in her second Grand Slam final and faces two-time defending Australian Open champion Aryna Sabalenka, who leads head-to-head series, 4-1; Sabalenka has won two previous encounters in Grand Slam tournaments.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Tomas Hertl and Jack Eichel scored power-play goals for Vegas as the Golden Knights defeated Dallas, 3-2, on Dec. 6 in their first meeting since the Stars eliminated Vegas in the first round of the playoffs last season; Dallas is 17-7-1 at home.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: The latest news and reports surrounding the X Games and athlete-focused content is featured, including profiles of the top athletes and artists, previews of the biggest events, special documentaries, and recaps of major events.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: The GameDay crew goes on the road to various locations at different campuses across the country and discusses the biggest games of the week, while evaluating player performances; experts weigh in on trending topics and teams throughout the nation.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 9 Kentucky (14-4, 3-2) is second in the country in scoring offense, averaging 89.2 ppg behind Otega Oweh, and won 16 of the last 18 meetings after taking both last season; Vanderbilt (15-4, 3-3) is 10-1 at home behind Jason Edwards.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 Duke (16-2, 8-0) won 12-straight games behind Cooper Flagg, who is tied for second in the ACC with 19.2 ppg; Wake Forest (15-4, 7-1) won six straight, and is 10-0 at home behind Hunter Sallis, who is tied with Flagg with 19.2 ppg.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: San Antonio and Indiana split victories in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Spurs claiming a 117-105 win in the final matchup on March 3; Victor Wembanyama posted 31 points and 12 rebounds for San Antonio in the home victory.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 7 Houston (15-3, 7-0) won 11-straight games behind the top scoring defense in the country, allowing 53.9 ppg; No. 12 Kansas (14-4, 5-2) is 9-1 at home this season behind Hunter Dickinson, and won at Allen Fieldhouse last season, 78-65.

programme.title: Postseason NFL Countdown
programme.desc: Upcoming NFL postseason matchups are previewed and evaluated by expert analysts, featuring highlights from previous games, profiles of playmakers on each team, a breakdown of what to expect, and updates on the latest news from around the league.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Texas and Ole Miss last met on Dec. 16, 2009, where the Longhorns claimed a 64-58 victory over the Rebels behind Brittainey Raven's 17 points and 8 rebounds; Shantell Black posted 15 points and 3 assists for Ole Miss in the defeat away from home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 6 Tennessee (17-2, 4-2) rebounded from its Vanderbilt loss with a 68-56 win over No. 14 Mississippi State behind Chaz Lanier, who is second in the SEC with 18.4 ppg; No. 1 Auburn (17-1, 5-0) won 10-straight games, and is 8-0 at home.

programme.title: College Wrestling
programme.desc: Coverage of wrestling at the college level.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: The inaugural golf league combines advanced technology with teams, which are made up of PGA TOUR players representing six different cities, facing off in a head-to-head competition; Jupiter Links GC (0-1) takes on Boston Common Golf (0-0) in Week 4.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 13 Texas A&M (15-4, 4-2) defeated the Longhorns, 80-60, on Jan. 4 behind 18 points from Zhuric Phelps and 15 from Pharrel Payne; Texas (13-6, 2-4) is 9-3 at home behind freshman Tre Johnson, who is fourth in the SEC with 18.2 ppg.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: Detailed analysis of coaching strategies for upcoming games in the National Football League; experts use the coaches' film to illustrate effective and ineffective strategies for the various matchups and provide an in-depth breakdown of potential game

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Baylor (12-6, 4-3) won the first meeting with the Utes since 1960, 81-56, on Dec. 31 behind 19 points from VJ Edgecombe and a Norchad Omier double-double; Utah (11-7, 3-4) is 10-2 at home behind Gabe Madsen, who leads the Utes with 15.3 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Pittsburgh (12-6, 3-4) dropped four straight since beating Stanford, 83-68, on Jan. 4; Syracuse (9-10, 3-5) is 8-3 at home this season behind J.J. Starling, who leads the team with 19 ppg, and won both meetings with the Panthers last season.

programme.title: Women's College Gymnastics
programme.desc: Oregon State and Auburn last met on Jan. 6, 2017, where the Beavers claimed a 195.575-195.275 victory over the Tigers behind an all-around win from Kaytianna McMillan; Auburn's Gracie Day scored a 9.850 on vault to take the event title.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Notre Dame (8-10, 2-5) is 1-8 away from home this season; Virginia (9-10, 2-6) ended a five-game skid with a 74-56 win over Boston College, and won 18 of the last 21 meetings with the Fighting Irish, including a 65-53 home win last season.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: In Louisiana, Eddie Adams and Jimmy get together for a day of redfish fishing.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston is joined by Paul Herbert from "Wicked Tuna" on a fishing expedition in hopes of reeling in trophy-caliber bluefin tuna, discussing the equipment they are using out on the water and the techniques they implement to find success.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Saint Joseph's (12-7, 3-3) won six of its last nine games; Dayton (13-6, 3-3) is 11-1 at home behind Nate Santos, who leads the Flyers in scoring with 14.1 ppg, and won its last four meetings with the Hawks after a 94-79 win last season.

programme.title: 2025 Australian Open
programme.desc: Defending champion Jannik Sinner seeks his third Grand Slam title as he faces Alexander Zverev, who appears in his third major final; Zverev leads the head-to-head series with Sinner, 4-2, but Sinner won the last meeting in Cincinnati, 7-6, 5-7, 7-6.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: Detailed analysis of coaching strategies for upcoming games in the National Football League; experts use the coaches' film to illustrate effective and ineffective strategies for the various matchups and provide an in-depth breakdown of potential game

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Minnesota beat Denver, 4-3, in the Western Conference semifinals from May, winning game 7, 98-90, behind 23 points from both Jaden McDaniels and Karl-Anthony Towns; the Nuggets' Jamal Murray and Nikola Jokic combined for 69 points in the loss.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma (14-4, 1-4) ended a four-game skid with an 82-62 win over South Carolina behind 22 points from Jalon Moore, who is third in the SEC with 18.3 ppg; Arkansas (12-7, 1-5) ended its 0-5 start in SEC play with a 68-65 win over Georgia.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Cincinnati (12-6, 2-5) dropped five of its last seven, but won its lone meeting with the Cougars last season, 71-60; BYU (12-6, 2-4) is 9-1 at home this season behind Richie Saunders, who leads the Cougars in scoring with 14.5 ppg.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Boston claimed a 4-1 series win over Dallas in the 2023-24 NBA Finals, winning game 5 with a 106-88 score behind 31 points and 11 assists from Jayson Tatum; Luka Doncic posted 28 points and 12 rebounds for the Mavericks in the defeat.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UAB (12-7, 5-1) won five-straight games; No. 24 Memphis (15-4, 5-1) is 7-2 at home behind PJ Haggerty, who is second in the country in scoring with 22.1 ppg, and won 19 of its last 21 meetings, including a 106-87 home win last season.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Baylor claimed a 71-50 victory over TCU in their lone meeting of the 2023-24 season on Jan. 3, 2024, behind 21 points and 2 rebounds from Bella Fontleroy; Sedona Prince posted 20 points and 10 rebounds for the Horned Frogs in the loss away from home.

programme.title: Women's Super League
programme.desc: Chelsea (10-1-0) has won three of the past four meetings with Arsenal (7-3-1) across all competitions after earning a 2-1 victory on the road in Week 4, as Mayra Ramírez and Sandy Baltimore each found the back of the net in the first half.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: An in-depth examination of a particular athlete or issue that has captured the attention of sports fanatics across the nation; coverage includes exclusive interviews, exhaustive reporting and extensive expert analysis regarding the subject.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Golden State claimed victories over Los Angeles in three of their four meetings in the 2023-2024 season, including the final matchup on Apr. 9, 134-120; Klay Thompson posted 27 points and 3 assists for the Warriors in the win away from home.

programme.title: The Fight Life
programme.desc: Considered as one of the best pound-for-pound Top Rank boxers, Naoya Inoue looks to his bout against Luis Nery at a sold-out Tokyo Dome as his stage to become a household name around the world and one of the more dominant current boxers.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Inside the College Football Playoff
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest news surrounding the College Football Playoff, breaking down recent highlights from the competing teams, the latest injury updates and discuss what the teams will need to in order to claim a national championship.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: UFC The Walk
programme.desc: Memorable bouts throughout UFC history are relived, showcasing the two fighters' paths to the bout, the training they went through to get ready for the contest and highlights from the bout to show who came out of the Octagon the winner.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback
programme.desc: Kelvin Gastelum (15-3) won his last two bouts since losing to Chris Weidman at UFC on Fox 25, as he faces Israel Adesanya (16-0), who looks to stay undefeated after beating Anderson Silva, for the interim UFC Middleweight Championship at UFC 236.

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback
programme.desc: Kelvin Gastelum (15-3) won his last two bouts since losing to Chris Weidman at UFC on Fox 25, as he faces Israel Adesanya (16-0), who looks to stay undefeated after beating Anderson Silva, for the interim UFC Middleweight Championship at UFC 236.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Penn State (13-6, 3-5) ended a four-game skid with an 80-72 win over Rutgers; Iowa (12-7, 3-5) is top five in the country in scoring, averaging 87.3 ppg behind Owen Freeman, and won 16 of the last 17 home meetings after a 90-81 win last season.

programme.title: College Basketball

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UCLA (13-6, 4-4) won 10 of its last 11 meetings with the Huskies after a 69-58 win on Dec. 3 behind 16 points from Tyler Bilodeau and Sebastian Mack; Washington (10-9, 1-7) dropped five-straight games, but is 8-4 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UCLA (13-6, 4-4) won 10 of its last 11 meetings with the Huskies after a 69-58 win on Dec. 3 behind 16 points from Tyler Bilodeau and Sebastian Mack; Washington (10-9, 1-7) dropped five-straight games, but is 8-4 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 21 Michigan (14-4, 6-1) won six of its last seven after an 80-76 win over Northwestern behind Vladislav Goldin; No. 11 Purdue (15-5, 7-2) is 9-1 at home, and won its last three meetings with the Wolverines after taking both last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (12-8, 5-4) is 2-6 away from home despite Eric Dixon, who leads the country with 24.9 ppg; No. 10 Marquette (16-3, 7-1) is 10-1 at home, and won its last seven meetings with the Wildcats after a 71-65 win in the 2024 Big East Tournament.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (12-8, 5-4) is 2-6 away from home despite Eric Dixon, who leads the country with 24.9 ppg; No. 10 Marquette (16-3, 7-1) is 10-1 at home, and won its last seven meetings with the Wildcats after a 71-65 win in the 2024 Big East Tournament.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Each bowler in the eight-player field will have two minutes to throw as many strikes as possible with the player with the most strikes advancing to the next round; Akron's Chris Via, the No. 1 seed, is the defending champion; winner receives $30,000.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Jakob Butturff earned top seed in the season-opening championship round after 18 games, taking down EJ Tackett and Ryan Barnes in best-of-seven bracket play; the top four seeds each won their respective brackets enroute to the stepladder finals.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Seton Hall (6-13, 1-7) lost four straight since beating DePaul, 85-80, in OT on Jan. 8; Creighton (13-6, 6-2) won four-straight games, and is 9-1 at home behind Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is fourth in the Big East in scoring with 17.4 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 19 UConn (14-5, 6-2) won its last four meetings with the Musketeers after a 94-89 overtime win on Dec. 18 behind 22 points from Solo Ball; Xavier (12-8, 4-5) is 9-2 at home behind Ryan Conwell, who is fifth in the Big East with 16.7 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: New Mexico (16-4, 8-1) won nine of its last 10 behind Donovan Dent, who leads Mountain West scoring with 18.9 ppg; UNLV (11-8, 5-3) is 9-2 at home this season behind Dedan Thomas Jr., and won 10 of its last 11 meetings with the Lobos.

programme.title: All Madden
programme.desc: John Madden made his impact felt in the football world through several different avenues, from becoming a Super Bowl winning coach with the Oakland Raiders to becoming a legendary commentator and influencing a video game franchise.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Connecticut claimed victories over Creighton in both of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup on Feb. 19 with a 73-53 scoreline; Paige Bueckers posted 24 points and 6 rebounds for the Huskies in the win at home.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: The disappearance of quarterback Tom Brady's jersey after leading the New England Patriots' epic comeback to beat the Atlanta Falcons in Super Bowl LI is chronicled, which includes exclusive conversations with Brady and the man who stole the jersey.

programme.desc: Jakob Butturff earned top seed in the season-opening championship round after 18 games, taking down EJ Tackett and Ryan Barnes in best-of-seven bracket play; the top four seeds each won their respective brackets enroute to the stepladder finals.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Jeff Gordon was coming off his second Cup Series title in three years, including a win at the 1997 Daytona 500, while seven-time Cup Series champion Dale Earnhardt sought his first win at the prestigious race that continued to elude him.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 21 Michigan (14-4, 6-1) won six of its last seven after an 80-76 win over Northwestern behind Vladislav Goldin; No. 11 Purdue (15-5, 7-2) is 9-1 at home, and won its last three meetings with the Wolverines after taking both last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UCLA (13-6, 4-4) won 10 of its last 11 meetings with the Huskies after a 69-58 win on Dec. 3 behind 16 points from Tyler Bilodeau and Sebastian Mack; Washington (10-9, 1-7) dropped five-straight games, but is 8-4 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (12-8, 5-4) is 2-6 away from home despite Eric Dixon, who leads the country with 24.9 ppg; No. 10 Marquette (16-3, 7-1) is 10-1 at home, and won its last seven meetings with the Wildcats after a 71-65 win in the 2024 Big East Tournament.

programme.desc: The documentary chronicles the lives of incarcerated basketball players at San Quentin State Prison and explores inmates' personal struggles as they search for redemption and transcendence both on and off the court.

programme.desc: Tyquone Greer and Marquise Pryor lead Orr Academy basketball into the upcoming season under head coach Lou Adams, as the team deals with the inequities and troubling surrounding of Chicago as they strive for a championship and collegiate dreams.

programme.desc: Cayman Islands U17 returns to the tournament for the first time since reaching the group stage in 2010; Bermuda U17, which is making its third appearance since 2018, reached group stage in both the 2018 and 2022 editions of the tournament.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Orlando claimed victories over Vegas in three of their four meetings from the 2024 season, including the final matchup on May 11 with a 3-0 scoreline; Courtney Schwan posted 11 kills and 8 digs for the Valkyries in the regular season win.

programme.title: 2025 Women's Concacaf U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: U.S. Virgin Islands U17 has won its last 15 contests after falling to Nicaragua U17, 10-0, on Aug. 29, 2023; Trinidad & Tobago U17 has won each of the two all-time meetings with USVI, including earning 13-0 wins in both 2013 and 2017.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: 2025 Women's Concacaf U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Guyana U17 did not qualify in last year's tournament after reaching the Round of 16 in the 2022 edition held in the Dominican Republic; Cuba U17 won the inaugural encounter against the Golden Jaguars with an 8-0 victory in the 2017 tournament.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Hilal (14-1-1) is unbeaten in 25 of the 27 all-time encounters after securing a 1-0 triumph at home on March 20, 2021, as André Carrillo scored in the 51st minute; Al-Qadsiah (11-1-4) has won eight of its last nine Saudi Pro League contests.
